chargeHist.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Samuel C Yonker

records.addlTxt: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
11:15 AM Defendant Samuel C Yonker in court, in custody.  Attorney David R. Knaapen in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court notes that Public Defender has not found counsel for defendant, but he is eligible. Court will proceed with preliminary hearing today.
Christopher Downs is sworn as a witness and questioned by Attorney Knaapen. He is a deputy with the Wood County Sheriff's Department. On 9/13/22, he was dispatched to a residence regarding a burglar alarm. When he arrived, a person identified as the defendant was at the residence, along with another individual. The witness identifies the defendant in the courtroom. The other person was identified as S.J.B. who indicated that on 9/10/22 the defendant became abusive to her and he put his hands around her neck and impeded her breathing. He observed bruises on the defendant's neck. When they placed defendant under arrest, defendant became resistive and kicked at the officers and struck Deputy Strey which caused him pain.
Defendant questions witness.  
Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the defendant committed it. Bound over for further proceedings. Bond is continued.
Arraignment scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 10:00 am.
No contact with victim or their residence - SJB. Absolute sobriety, Do not enter any establishment whose primary purpose is to sell or serve alcohol. No possession or consumption of alcohol. $2500
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment on September 20, 2022 at 11:15 am.
No contact w/victim or their residence - SJB. Absolute sobriety, do not enter any establishments that sell or serve alcohol. No possession of consumption of alcohol.

1:48 PM Defendant Samuel C Yonker appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Gavin Grubofski in court for Samuel C Yonker.  Attorney David R. Knaapen in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court finds probable cause to continue this matter. This will be bound over for preliminary hearing and arraignment. Bond is set.
